comments.body: See comments on gitter.. but I'd prefer to move FAQs to the wiki.
I also added a comment about start_date with datetime.now() to the common pitfalls wiki.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +98,102 @@backfill CLI command, get overridden by the backfill's command ``start_date``.
This allows for a backfill on tasks that have ``depends_on_past=True`` to
actually start, if it wasn't the case, the backfill just wouldn't start.

comments.body:
Personally I think `pool` is too specific to be put in this section.

On the other hand, if folks agree it's a good idea to add this here, you need to update line 175 ;-)
I will change it to **a few** so that this documentation is more **scalable** in some senseXD

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +179,183 @@- ``task_concurrency``: This variable controls the number of concurrent running task instances across ``dag_runs`` per task.
- ``max_active_runs``: the Airflow scheduler will run no more than ``max_active_runs`` DagRuns of your DAG at a given time. If you do not set the ``max_active_runs`` in your DAG, the scheduler will use the default value from the ``max_active_runs_per_dag`` entry in your ``airflow.cfg``.
- ``pool``: This variable controls the number of concurrent running task instances assigned to the pool.

How can we reduce the airflow UI page load time?
